name: Erupting Shrapnel
effect: 1/round, after the Avenger makes a successful ranged attack, they may force their target to pass an Engineering save. On a failure, the target is embedded with explosive shrapnel, and they take {2/3/4} AP explosive damage each time they make a ranged or melee attack roll until the end of their next turn; this damage is applied after the attack roll is made. Affected targets are aware of this effect. After Revenge is activated, characters automatically fail this save, and each time the target makes a ranged or melee attack roll, they are also pushed 2 spaces in a direction of the Avenger's choice.

name: Vanguard Armor
effect: The Avenger has Resistance to all damage while they are within Range 3 of an allied non-Grunt, non-Drone character. After Revenge is activated, this trait is disabled

name: Revenge
effect: The first time an allied non-Grunt, non-Drone character within Range 5 is destroyed by a hostile character, the Avenger gains 8/10/12 Overshield, and for the rest of the scene the Slug Pistol deals double damage (bonus damage is not doubled) and they gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves.

name: Cycle of Violence
effect: The Avenger may Boost towards the triggering character. If the allied character was destroyed, the Avenger may also attack the triggering character with the Slug Pistol. This reaction can be taken as many times per round as it is triggered
trigger: An allied non-Grunt, non-Drone character within Range 5 fails a save or is hit by an attack from a hostile character to which the Avenger has line of sight.

name: Fervor
effect: When Revenge is activated, all allied non-Grunt, non-Drone characters within Range 5 gain 4/5/6 Overshield.

name: Determination
effect: The first time the Avenger is destroyed, it instead survives at 1 HP. If they have not activated Revenge this scene, immediately activate it, but the Avenger only gains 4/5/6 Overshield when it is activated this way.

name: Judgement Shotgun
effect:
On Critical Hit: This weapon deals +1d6 bonus damage.

This weapon automatically reloads whenever an allied non-Grunt, non-Drone character within Range 5 is destroyed by a hostile character.
on_hit: Target must pass an Agility save or be knocked Prone.

name: Rallying Cry
effect: The Avenger chooses a non-Grunt, non-Drone allied character within line of sight; that character may immediately Boost towards the Avenger as a reaction; when Revenge is activated, the Avenger also gains soft cover until the end of their next turn. The Avenger can't use this trait if they are Jammed.

name: Umbral Shroud
effect:
At the start of any combat, when they arrive as reinforcements, or as a protocol, the Lurker can create a rippling storm of nanites – a Shroud Zone. This is a Blast 1 area within Range 10 that can can overlap with obstructions (like cover or terrain) when created, but not characters.Shroud Zones provide soft cover both to the Lurker and to allied characters at least partially within them.

While inside a Shroud Zone:
  • The Lurker becomes Invisibile.
  • Hostile Characters at least partially within them are Shredded as long as they remain within the Shroud Zone.


Shroud Zones can be dispersed by making a successful tech attack or an attack with a weapon that targets E-Defense. They have E-Defense 10/12/14 and disperse upon any successful attack.

The Lurker can have no more than three Shroud Zones active at a time; if they create another, one of their currently active Shroud Zones of their choice dissipates. Shroud Zones also dissipate when the Lurker is destroyed. All Lurkers can utilize all Shroud Zones, even those created by other Lurkers. Shroud Zones can overlap each other, but their effects do not stack.

name: Scouring Whip
effect: This weapon gains Threat 3 and +1 Accuracy when used inside a Shroud Zone. Attacks made against targets within a Shroud Zone deal double damage (bonus damage is not doubled).
on_hit: The target is pulled adjacent to the Lurker, or as close as possible

name: Umbral Shift
effect: The Lurker teleports to a free space within a Shroud Zone of their choice.

name: Defensive Shroud
effect: The Lurker may create a Shroud Zone centered on its location, then teleport to a free space within a Shroud Zone of their choice.

name: Absolute Darkness
effect: Hostile characters at least partially within a Shroud Zone do not have line of sight to their allies, and their allies do not have line of sight to them.

name: Devouring Shard
effect: The Lurker creates a Cone 3 torrent of razor sharp nanites, which must be placed with at least one space adjacent to a Shroud Zone. All characters within the affected area must pass an Engineering save or take {3/4/5} AP kinetic damage.

name: Empower Shroud
effect: The Lurker expands an existing Shroud Zone to Burst 2. This can cause it to envelop other characters. In addition, it now takes two successful attacks to disperse zone instead of one.

name: Kinetic Transference
effect: Draw a Line between the Lurker and a Shroud Zone within Range 10. The Lurker teleports to a free space within that Shroud Zone, and all hostile characters within the Line's path take {3/4/5} AP kinetic damage. One hostile character within the Line's path must pass a Hull save or be pulled directly into the Shroud Zone the Lurker teleported to, or as closely as possible.

name: Umbral Clone
effect: The Lurker creates a fragile nanite-constructed pseudochassis within a Shroud Zone of their choice. This construct is another Lurker with the Grunt template. The construct takes its own independent activations, can act on the round it is created, and benefits from Shroud Zones, but it only can only use Scouring Whip and Umbral Shift. Only one such construct can be active at a time, and if another construct is created, the first one dissolves and is destroyed. Otherwise, it lasts for the rest of the scene or until the Lurker is destroyed.

name: Imprison
effect: The Spite chooses a character within Sensors and infects them with a catalyzing virus. Characters infected by this virus take 1 heat at the start of their turn, plus 1 additional heat for each successive turn they remain infected beyond the first up to a maximum of 3 heat per turn, and cannot clear heat by any means except for overheating. This effect lasts for the rest of the scene, until the Spite is destroyed, until the Spite uses this system on a different character, or until the infected character moves adjacent to (or begins their turn adjacent to) the Spite.

name: Edict
effect:
The Spite adjusts the parameters of Imprison's virus on the fly, causing further instability. They choose one of the following effects as a protocol, as well as automatically choosing one whenever they use Imprison, which lasts until the end of the target's next turn; infected characters are aware of this effect when it is chosen. The infected character must then abide by the chosen effect or they take {5/6/7} AP energy damage at the end of their turn. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

This effect immediately ends when the infection ends, and characters can only be affected by one such effect at a time; if they are already affected by one, the Spite chooses which one takes precedence.
  • At the end of the character's next turn, the must be Prone; they may drop Prone during their turn as a free action.
  • At the end of the character's next turn, they must not be adjacent to another character or piece of terrain Size 1 or greater.
  • At the end of the character's next turn, they must not have attacked any character other than the Spite.

name: Enthrone
effect: The Spite becomes Immobilized and generates a crackling defensive shield around an allied character within Sensors. While this shield is active, ranged and melee attacks against the shielded character receive +1 Difficulty, and any characters that make ranged or melee attacks against the shielded character take {3/4/5} AP energy damage before the attack roll is made. This effects lasts until the Spite uses this system on a different character, ends it as a quick action, or is destroyed.

name: Guardian
effect: Adjacent allied characters can use the Spite for hard cover.

name: Seize
effect: A hostile character within Sensors must pass a Systems save or take {2/3/4} heat and become Immobilized until the end of their next turn. On a success, they are Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Crown of Thorns
effect:
Edict gains the following additional effect to choose from:
  • At the end of the character's next turn, they must not have used Overcharge that turn.

name: Feedback Shield
effect: Any character that successfully damages a character benefiting from Enthrone's energy shield must pass a Systems save. On a failure, they become Jammed until the end of their next turn and the effects of Enthrone immediately end. Each character can only be forced to make this save 1/round, and characters affected by Imprison automatically fail this save

name: Condemnation
effect: The Spite chooses one of Edict's effects and applies it to all hostile characters of its choice within Sensors, lasting until the end of each affected character's next turn or until the Spite is destroyed.

name: Excoriate
effect: Hostile characters which force the Spite to move via involuntary movement (Knockback, push, pull, etc) take 1 heat per point of movement inflicted.

name: Swap Kit
effect: The Strider has two kits consisting of unique weapons, systems, and traits, the Marksman Kit and Skirmisher Kit. Each kit comes with a special Kit Bonus that activates at the start of their turn, as well as a Swap Bonus that only activates when they use this trait to swap to that kit; if the Strider chooses to gain the Kit Bonus, then they can't activate this trait (and thus gain the Swap Bonus) until the start of their next turn. When one of the Strider's weapons or systems are destroyed, it must be chosen from their active kit.

name: Swap Bonus
effect:
Marksmen Kit Swap Bonus: This turn only, the Ranger Long Rifle ignores the Ordnance tag.

Skirmisher Kit Swap Bonus: The Strider makes an attack against a character of their choice within Range 5 using the Explosive Carbine as a free action.
trigger: The Strider swaps to the Marksman Kit or Skirmisher Kit.

name: Kit Bonus
effect:
Marksmen Kit Kit Bonus: As a protocol, the Strider may Lock On to a hostile character within Sensors and line of sight.

Skirmisher Kit Kit Bonus: At the start of their turn, the Strider may move 2 spaces. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.
trigger: The Strider starts their turn equipped with the Marksman Kit or Skirmisher Kit.

name: Ranger Long Rifle
effect:
On Critical Hit: This weapon's damage can't be reduced in any way.

This weapon can't attack targets within Range 5.

name: Flash Grenade
effect: The Strider throws a grenade at a character within Range 5, forcing them to make an Agility save. On a failure, the target only has line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn. On a success, they become Impaired until the end of their next turn instead. This system automatically recharges whenever the Strider swaps kits

name: Adaptive Camouflage
effect: At the end of its turn, the Strider is shrouded in a camouflage field that treats all attacks originating beyond Range 5 as if it was Invisible. This lasts until it moves, takes a reaction, or swaps kits.

name: Reposition
effect: The Strider moves spaces equal to their Speed. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.
trigger: Another character in Sensors begins their turn.

name: Smoke Grenade
effect: The Strider throws a smoke grenade at a space within Range 5, creating a Blast 2 cloud of smoke. This area provides soft cover until the end of the scene, or until the Strider uses this system again.

name: Siege Loadout
effect:
The Strider's Swap Bonuses gain the following effects:
  • Marksman Kit Swap Bonus: The Strider may deploy a Size 1 piece of hard cover in any free adjacent space, which lasts for the rest of the scene or until the Strider uses this ability again.
  • Skirmisher Kit Swap Bonus: The Strider may scatter caltrops in a free Blast 1 zone within Range 5, turning it into difficult terrain for the rest of the scene or until the Strider uses this ability again.

name: Recon Loadout
effect:
The Strider's Kit Bonuses gain the following effects:
  • Marksman Kit Kit Bonus: The Strider may launch a flare to a space within Range 15, where it begins projecting bright light in a Blast 1 area. All characters in the affected area – including those that move into the affected area or start their turn within it – lose Invisible and Hidden, and cannot Hide or turn Invisible within the area. This effect lasts until the start of the Strider's next turn.
  • Skirmisher Kit Kit Bonus: The Strider may choose an allied character within Range 5, and that character may immediately move 2 spaces. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.

name: Survival Knife
effect: This weapon is considered part of both kits at once, and automatically returns to the Strider whenever they swap kits.
on_hit: Targets become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Spare Parts
effect: When the Strider swaps kits, they may spend a charge from this system, and either they or an adjacent allied character regains 5/6/7 HP and gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves until the end of their next turn. If the Strider is destroyed before this system is expended, they leave behind a wreck that can be salvaged for parts; an allied character adjacent to the wreck can use this system as a quick action, gaining the benefits. The wreck is then destroyed.

name: Weathering
effect: The Strider ignores difficult terrain.
